name: Linear

aliases.name: Space
aliases.comment: A mechanism for specificying the context of various operations. Basically, I want to be able to use my rowReduce function for real and complex numbers. So, I write a real and complex space and supply the real one to rowReduce when I'm using real numbers and the complex one to rowReduce when using complex numbers. The specalize function (TBW) gives a record containing all functions like rowReduce for a given space.
aliases.type: { zero : a , one : a , add : a -> a -> a , mult : a -> a -> a , sub : a -> a -> a , div : a -> a -> a , fromReal : Float -> a }

values.name: allPermutationMatricies
values.comment: Generates all possible permutation matrices of a size nfor a Space a.

values.name: colVector
values.comment: Generates a matrix that is just a column vector.

values.name: combineRow
values.comment:
Adds one row times a scalar to another. To add the 3rd row times 4 to the 2nd row:

    combineRow realSpace 4 2 3 matrix
values.type: Linear.Space a -> a -> Int -> Int -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: complexSpace
values.comment: An example of a space

values.name: diagProd
values.comment: Calculates the products of the numbers in the diagnoal of a matrix.

values.name: dimV
values.comment: Length of a vector

values.name: dotProd
values.comment: Computes the dot product of two vectors in a space.
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Expression.Vector a -> Expression.Vector a -> a

values.name: eigenValues
values.comment: Retuns Just a vector of eigen values or nothing if the matrix is not square or something horrible happens. Uses native code.

values.name: eigenVectors
values.comment: Retuns Just a matrix of eigenvectors where each eigenvector is a column. Returns Nothing is the matrix is not square or something horrible happens. Uses native code.

values.name: elementWise
values.comment: Basically List.map2 but for matricies.
values.type: (a -> b -> c) -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix b -> Expression.Matrix c

values.name: extendMatrix
values.comment:
Extends a matrix to new rows + old rows by new cols + old cols and fills the new elements with some member of the type a. To extend a matrix of 2 by 2 integers to 3 by 3 integers with 0s:

                                 (1 1 0)
                       (1 1)     (1 1 0)
    extendMatrix 1 1 0 (1 1) =   (0 0 0)
values.type: Int -> Int -> a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: extendMatrixTo
values.comment:
Like extendMatrix but the rows and columns specified are the new dimensions of the matrix (as opposed to adding row many rows and col many columns). The same example: 

                                   (1 1 0)
                         (1 1)     (1 1 0)
    extendMatrixTo 3 3 0 (1 1) =   (0 0 0)
values.type: Int -> Int -> a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: fromList
values.comment:
Generates a matrix of size rows*cols from a list. If rows*cols \= List.length xs then it crashes. 

                          (0 1 2)
                          (3 4 5)
    fromList [0..8] 3 3 = (6 7 8)
values.type: List a -> Int -> Int -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: fromLists
values.comment: Generats a matrix from a list of lists where each list is a row.

values.name: gaussianEliminationBackwards
values.comment: Reduces a matrix to a lower triangular matrix if possible. Does not signal if this is impossible (yet)...
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: gaussianEliminationForward
values.comment: Reduces a matrix to a upper triangular matrix if possible. Does not signal if this is impossible (yet)...
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: horizontalJoin
values.comment: Horizontally joins togeather one matrix with another.
values.type: Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: identity
values.comment: Generates an n by n matrix that is the identity matrix for the Space a.

values.name: indexedMap
values.comment: An indexed map function for a matrix. The mapping function take the current row and then the current column.
values.type: (Int -> Int -> a -> b) -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix b

values.name: indexedMapVector
values.comment: What it says on the tin
values.type: (Int -> a -> b) -> Expression.Vector a -> Expression.Vector b

values.name: invert
values.comment: Attemps to invert a matrix. Returns Just (the inverse) if it can and returns Nothing if there is no inverse.
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Maybe.Maybe (Expression.Matrix a)

values.name: invertable
values.comment: Checks if a matrix is invertable.

values.name: isIdentity
values.comment: Tests if a matrix is an identity matrix for a particular space.

values.name: isSquare
values.comment: Tests if any matrix is square.

values.name: isTriangular
values.comment: Tests if a matrix is triangular in a space a

values.name: map
values.comment: A map function for a matrix

values.name: mapVector
values.comment: What it says on the tin

values.name: matrix
values.comment:
Generates a matrix. For example, if you wanted to generate a 2 by 3 matrix where each member was the sum of the indicies:
                                 (0 1 2)
    matrix 2 3 (\x y -> x + y) = (1 2 3)
values.type: Int -> Int -> (Int -> Int -> a) -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: matrixMult
values.comment: Matrix multiplication.
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: minor
values.comment: Creates the minor matrix of from the ith element of the 1st row. It returns the ith element of the 1st row, the sign (-1.0 or 1.0), and the minor matrix.
values.type: Int -> Expression.Matrix a -> ( a, Float, Expression.Matrix a )

values.name: minors
values.comment: Returns all possible minors with their signs and corresponding elements.
values.type: Expression.Matrix a -> Array.Array ( a, Float, Expression.Matrix a )

values.name: ncols
values.comment: What it says on the tin

values.name: nrows
values.comment: What it says on the tin

values.name: permMatrix
values.comment: Generates a permutation matrix for Space a by switching two columns of the identity matrix of a size. Takes the size then ith and jth columns.
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Int -> Int -> Int -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: rowReduce
values.comment: Row reduces a matrix in a space a
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: rowVector
values.comment: Generates a matrix that is just a row vector.

values.name: same
values.comment: Generates a row by col matrix of one member of type a.

values.name: scaleMatrix
values.comment: Scales a matrix in some space by some scalar in that space.
values.type: Linear.Space a -> a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: scaleRow
values.comment: Scales just one row by some scalar.
values.type: Linear.Space a -> Int -> a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: scaleVector
values.comment: Scales a vector in some space by some scalar in that space.
values.type: Linear.Space a -> a -> Expression.Vector a -> Expression.Vector a

values.name: set
values.comment:
Sets a value of one matrix cell. To set the 3rd value of the 2nd row:
    set 2 3 replacement matrix
values.type: Int -> Int -> a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: setCol
values.comment: Sets a column to the value of another vector
values.type: Int -> Expression.Vector a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: setRow
values.comment: Sets a row to the value of another vector
values.type: Int -> Expression.Vector a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: simpleDet
values.comment: Calculates the determiant of a matrix with the cofactor expansion. This is O((n-1)!). I will probably add other versions of it to use rowReduction, but this can be done later.

values.name: splitBlocks
values.comment: I'm getting lazy about this. Just see https://hackage.haskell.org/package/matrix-0.3.4.4/docs/Data-Matrix.html#g:8
values.type: Int -> Int -> Expression.Matrix a -> ( Expression.Matrix a , Expression.Matrix a , Expression.Matrix a , Expression.Matrix a )

values.name: submatrix
values.comment: Selects a subMatrix. The integer arguments are start row, end row, start column, and end column.
values.type: Int -> Int -> Int -> Int -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: switchRow
values.comment: Switches two rows of a matrix.
values.type: Int -> Int -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a

values.name: toList
values.comment: Converts a matrix to a list

values.name: toLists
values.comment: Converts a matrix to a list of lists where each list is a row.

values.name: toVector
values.comment: Converts a matrix to a single vector containing all elements

values.name: trace
values.comment: Calculates the trace of a matrix.

values.name: transpose
values.comment: Transposes a matrix.

values.name: unsafeGetCol
values.comment: Gets a column

values.name: unsafeGetDiag
values.comment: Gets the diagonal of a matrix.

values.name: unsafeGetM
values.comment:
Gets an element from a matrix and crashes if it is out of bounds. To get the 2nd element of the 1st row:
    
    unsafeGetM 1 2 m

values.name: unsafeGetRow
values.comment: Gets a row.

values.name: vector
values.comment:
Generates a vector of length n from a function that takes an index and generates a member of the vector:

    vector 2 (\x -> x) = Vector (0 1 2)

values.name: vectorFromList
values.comment: Generates a vector from a list.

values.name: vectorMap2
values.comment: Basically List.map2 but for vectors.
values.type: (a -> b -> c) -> Expression.Vector a -> Expression.Vector b -> Expression.Vector c

values.name: verticalJoin
values.comment: Vertically joins togeather one matrix with another.
values.type: Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a -> Expression.Matrix a
